Cops: 4 Shot After Robbers Storm Chicago Pizza Shop
 Thursday, November 26, 2009 
 CHICAGO - Police say four people have been shot after gunmen stormed a Chicago restaurant and demanded money.
 
 Police were called to Margarita's Pizza around midnight Thursday. Investigators say one man is in custody but police are looking for two others. It isn't yet clear if money was stolen.
 
 Police say a 61-year-old man shot in the chin and a 32-year-old woman shot in the torso were taken to John H. Stroger Jr. Hospital. A nursing supervisor said Thursday morning that the man is in critical but stable condition and the woman had been released.
 
 A 29-year-old man shot in the shoulder and a 22-year-old man shot in the torso were taken to Northwestern Memorial Hospital. Their conditions haven't been released.
 
 Police say they found a weapon, but details haven't been released.

post_info.post_title: wait a minute doesn't Chicago have good gun control?

Chicago is, naturally, going to blame the laxer gun laws of the rest of Illinois, licensed dealers operating just outside of city limits, and neighboring states that don't share the same laws of Chicago, for this matter. They're gonna try and point the finger at other people who were nowhere near the city when this went down, make it like it's the fault of somebody else entirely.
 
 I've got news for Chicago supporters. It's not the job of the rest of the state, or the rest of America, to ensure that they have the same laws as you just so your laws are uniform cover vast distances. If you can't run your own city with the passage of such inane laws that aren't in effect anywhere else, then get rid of them and embrace the rest of the state in how they do things. You're doing nothing but setting yourself up for fail by sticking out like a sore thumb.
